abstract.text: Information about the capabilities of the port and the hardware channels it supports.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A port description object describes a single input or output port associated with an audio route. Examples of audio ports include a device’s built-in speaker, a microphone on a wired headset, and a Bluetooth device supporting the Advanced Audio Distribution Profile (A2DP).
You can query the audio session’s
property to get information about the active set of input and output ports. To change the current audio routing, call the
method. For example, on a device with a wired headset attached, the audio session’s
array may contain two port descriptions: one for the headset microphone and one for the device’s built-in microphone. You can use the audio session’s
method to select the headset or built-in microphone for audio input.

abstract.text: Play, record, and process audio; configure your app’s system audio behavior.
A structure that defines the available input and output port types.
An array of input ports available for audio routing.
A description of the current audio route’s input and output ports.
A notification the system posts when its audio route changes.
Sets the preferred input port for audio routing.
A class that describes a hardware channel on the current device.
Information about the capabilities of the port and the hardware channels it supports.
An array of channel objects that describe the port’s input or output channels.
The available data sources for the port.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the associated hardware port has built-in processing for two-way voice communication.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the port supports spatial audio playback.
A descriptive name for the port.
The type of the port.
The preferred audio data source for the port.
The currently selected audio data source for the port.
Sets the preferred audio data source for the port.
A system-assigned unique identifier (UID) for the port.
An object that describes the input and output ports associated with a session’s audio route.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
